alert.note: Alert for Clay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 29 at 11:14PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Indiana, including the following counties, Clay and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Center Point, Bowling Green and Saline City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
